data.chText: 想象力；想象
data.enText: the ability to create pictures in your mind; the part of your mind that does this

data.chText: 生动的 / 丰富的想象
data.enText: a vivid/fertile imagination

data.chText: 他缺乏想象力。
data.enText: He's got no imagination.

data.chText: 不难猜出她的意思。
data.enText: It doesn't take much imagination to guess what she meant.

data.chText: 我不告诉你他的反应，你自己去想好了。
data.enText: I won't tell you his reaction ─I'll leave that to your imagination .

data.chText: 不要一味凭空想象。
data.enText: Don't let your imagination run away with you (= don't use too much imagination) .

data.chText: 新出台的政策似乎恰恰投合了公众的喜好。
data.enText: The new policies appear to have caught the imagination of the public (= they find them interesting and exciting) .

data.chText: 没人讨厌你——都是你在胡思乱想。
data.enText: Nobody hates you─it's all in your imagination .

data.chText: 你自己动动脑筋嘛！
data.enText: Use your imagination! (= used to tell sb that they will have to guess the answer to the question they have asked you, usually because it is obvious or embarrassing)

data.chText: 想象的事物；幻想物
data.enText: something that you have imagined rather than sth that exists

data.chText: 她再也不能分清幻想和现实了。
data.enText: She was no longer able to distinguish between imagination and reality.

data.chText: 是我的错觉，还是你确实瘦了许多？
data.enText: Is it my imagination or have you lost a lot of weight?

data.chText: 创造力；创作力
data.enText: the ability to have new and exciting ideas

data.chText: 他的作品缺乏想象。
data.enText: His writing lacks imagination.

data.chText: 稍微动点脑筋，就能把这个地方变得富丽堂皇。
data.enText: With a little imagination , you could turn this place into a palace.
leave nothing/little to the imagination

data.chText: （暴露身体）没有想象的余地
data.enText: to allow more of sb's body to be seen than usual

data.chText: 她的紧身连衣裙令身材显露无遗。
data.enText: Her tight-fitting dress left nothing to the imagination.
a figment of sb's imagination

data.chText: 凭空想象的事物；臆造的东西；虚构的事
data.enText: something that sb has imagined and that does not really exist
not by any stretch of the imagination
by no stretch of the imagination

data.chText: 任凭怎么想也不；再怎么说也不
data.enText: used to say strongly that sth is not true, even if you try to imagine or believe it

data.chText: 再怎么说，她也称不上漂亮。
data.enText: She could not, by any stretch of the imagination, be called beautiful.

simple_means.memory_skill: imagine 想象 + ation 行为，过程，状态 → 想象

data.enText: leave nothing/little to the imagination

data.chText: （暴露身体）没有想象的余地
data.enText: to allow more of sb's body to be seen than usual

data.chText: 她的紧身连衣裙令身材显露无遗。
data.enText: Her tight-fitting dress left nothing to the imagination.
a figment of sb's imagination

data.chText: 凭空想象的事物；臆造的东西；虚构的事
data.enText: something that sb has imagined and that does not really exist
not by any stretch of the imagination
by no stretch of the imagination

data.chText: 任凭怎么想也不；再怎么说也不
data.enText: used to say strongly that sth is not true, even if you try to imagine or believe it

data.chText: 再怎么说，她也称不上漂亮。
data.enText: She could not, by any stretch of the imagination, be called beautiful.

tr: the formation of a mental image of something that is not perceived as real and is not present to the senses
example: popular imagination created a world of demons
imagination reveals what the world could be

tr: the ability to deal resourcefully with unusual problems
the ability to form mental images of things or events
example: he could still hear her in his imagination

value.def: Your imagination is the ability that you have to form pictures or ideas in your mind of things that are new and exciting, or things that you have not experienced.

example.ex: Antonia is a woman with a vivid imagination...
example.tran: 安东尼娅是个想象力丰富的女人。

example.ex: Alistair had a logical mind, and little imagination...
example.tran: 阿利斯泰尔逻辑思维能力很强,但缺乏想象力。

example.ex: The Government approach displays a lack of imagination.
example.tran: 政府的方案显得缺乏想象力。

value.def: Your imagination is the part of your mind which allows you to form pictures or ideas of things that do not necessarily exist in real life.

example.ex: Long before I ever went there, Africa was alive in my imagination.
example.tran: 早在我真正踏足之前很久,非洲就已在我的脑海中活灵活现了。

value.def: If you say that someone or something captured your imagination, you mean that you thought they were interesting or exciting when you saw them or heard them for the first time.

example.ex: Italian football captured the imagination of the nation last season.
example.tran: 上个赛季意大利足球吸引了全国上下的注意。

value.tran: 吸引…的注意力;摄人魂魄;引人入胜

value.def: If you say that something stretches your imagination, you mean that it is good because it makes you think about things that you had not thought about before.

example.ex: Their films are exciting and really stretch the imagination.
example.tran: 他们的电影非常精彩且发人深省。

xrse.def: not by any stretch of the imagination

trans: 只是我的想象；只是想想而已；一厢情愿；一廂情願；只是幻觉
道德想象力；道德想像；有道德想象；道德的想像力；道德想象

rootsaffixes.indicate: 表名词，“行为，过程，状态，结果”
rootsaffixes.title: -ation

partsOfSpeech.dec: ap 加强 + prob 正直 + ation 行为，过程，状态，结果 → 认为正直 → 认可
combine 结合 + ation 行为，过程，状态，结果 → 结合，联合
determine 决定 + ation 行为，过程，状态，结果 → 决定
excite 使兴奋 + ation 行为，过程，状态，结果 → 兴奋
explain 解释，说明 + ation 行为，过程，状态，结果 → 解释，说明
imagine 想象 + ation 行为，过程，状态，结果 → 想象
invite 邀请 + ation 行为，过程，状态，结果 → 邀请；邀请书
prepare 准备 + ation 行为，过程，状态，结果 → 准备
preserve 保护 + ation 行为，过程，状态，结果 → 保护；贮藏
provoke 激怒 + ation 行为，过程，状态，结果 → 激怒
repute 名誉 + ation 行为，过程，状态，结果 → 名声
revoke 取消 + ation 行为，过程，状态，结果 → 取消；撤销
starve 使饿死 + ation 行为，过程，状态，结果 → 饥饿
